document.docAuthor: Trjapitzin, Vladimir A. & Triapitsyn, Serguei V.
document.docTitle: Brethesiella flava Trjapitzin & Triapitsyn 2006, comb. n.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Brethesiella (Hymenoptera: Encyrtidae) from California, USA, a parasitoid of Steatococcus tabernicolus (Hemiptera: Margarodidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Brethesiella (Hymenoptera: Encyrtidae) from California, USA, a parasitoid of Steatococcus tabernicolus (Hemiptera: Margarodidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined: Holotype female on point [ USNM ], in poor condition, labeled: 1. “parts mounted”; 2. “4274° “aring
Icerya palmeri
Tabasco Mex June 28–97 .”; 3. “ Holotype ”; 4. “Type No. 28143 U.S. N.M.”; 5. “
Aztecencyrtus flavus Timb.
Type”. Also parts of the holotype (mouthparts, an antenna [missing a clava], and a forewing) mounted on a slide [ USNM ], labeled: 1. “
Aztecencyrtus flavus Timb.
Female antenna, wings mouthparts. Tabasco , Mexico . June 28, 1897 . no. 4274°”; 2. “Type No. 28143 U.S. N.M.”.

Host
Icerya palmeri Riley & Howard
( Timberlake 1926 ).

Comments Member of the
flava
species group. The forewing of the holotype female is about 3.1x as long as wide.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 7, 8.
Brethesiella
spp. 7.
B. mojave
,
sp. n.
, male genitalia (paratype). 8.
B. flava
, forewing venation (female, holotype).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Aztecencyrtus iceryae (Howard)
:
Noyes 1980 : 180
;
Trjapitzin et al. 2004
: 52
.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype female, in poor condition, on point (mesosoma and a forewing) and a card (metasoma and leg parts) [ USNM ], labeled: 1. “ Holotype ”; 2. “Kingston J. 1892”; 3. “4650°”; 4. “Type No. 1490 U.S.N.M.”; 5. “
Cerchysius iceryae How.
Type”; 6. “female
Cerchysius iceryae Howard
det. J.S. Noyes , 1978 HOLOTYPE ”. One forewing from the holotype was slide­mounted at UCRC in Canada balsam in 2005.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9, 10.
Brethesiella iceryae
(female, holotype). 9. Forewing. 10. Forewing venation.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Member of the
flava
species group. The forewing of the holotype female ( Fig. 9 ) is about 2.9x as long as wide. Somewhat similar in coloration of the body (especially the gaster) and infuscation of the forewing to
B. flava
; however, in
B. iceryae
( Fig. 10 ) the stigmal vein of the forewing is notably longer than the postmarginal vein (about equal in length in
B. flava
, Fig. 8 ), also these two veins are at a notably wider angle to each other and the area between them is significantly more setose in
B. iceryae
than in
B. flava
.

We thank Vladimir V. Berezovskiy (UCRC) for dissecting and slide­mounting two of the paratype specimens of the new species in Canada
balsam, and Michael W. Gates for the loans of the type material from the USNM . John S. Noyes ( BMNH ) made many useful suggestions on the initial draft of the manuscript. Svetlana N. Myartseva ( Universidad Autónoma de Tamaulipas , Ciudad Victoria , Tamaulipas , Mexico ) kindly let us examine the specimens of
Brethesiella
reared by her in Mexico
.
